name: Build the 'LinkZip' URL Shortener API
description: This project challenges you to build a robust API for a URL shortening service. Users will submit a long URL and receive a shorter, unique 'zip code' that redirects to the original URL. This project moves beyond simple CRUD and requires you to think about data generation, HTTP redirects, and tracking state.

tasks.name: Implement Core Shortening and Redirect Logic
tasks.description: Your first task is to build the main functionality. You need an endpoint to accept a long URL and return a unique short code, and another endpoint to handle the redirection when someone uses the short link.

endpoints.description: Accepts a long URL and creates a unique, short identifier.
Redirects the user to the original long URL associated with the zip_code.

test_cases.name: Shorten URL: Valid Request
test_cases.description: Tests if a long URL can be successfully shortened.

test_cases.name: Shorten URL: Invalid URL
test_cases.description: Tests that the API rejects an invalid URL format.

test_cases.name: Redirect: Follow a valid zip_code
test_cases.description: Tests if using a valid zip_code results in a redirect. The test runner should NOT follow the redirect.

test_cases.name: Redirect: Use a non-existent zip_code
test_cases.description: Tests that the API returns a 404 for a zip_code that doesn't exist.

tasks.name: Implement Analytics Endpoint
tasks.description: Your second task is to provide a way for users to see how many times their shortened link has been used. You will need to track the click count and expose it via a new endpoint.

endpoints.description: Retrieves the usage statistics for a given zip_code.

test_cases.name: Setup: Create a new link for analytics testing
test_cases.description: Creates a fresh URL to ensure analytics tests are isolated.

test_cases.name: Analytics: Get initial stats
test_cases.description: Checks the initial click count for the new link, which should be 0.

test_cases.name: Act: Trigger a redirect to increment click count
test_cases.description: Performs a GET on the short URL to simulate a user click.

test_cases.name: Analytics: Verify click count increases after redirect
test_cases.description: Checks that after a redirect is performed, the click count is now at least 1.
